CS2: A Problem-Filled Experience

The game is problematic from top to bottom. AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no optimization. I shoot the enemy — they don’t die; I shoot a wall — it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

CS2: Sorunlarla Dolu Bir Deneyim

Oyun baştan sona problemli. AWP flick atışları nişan aldığınız yerin gerisine gidiyor. Optimizasyon yok. Rakibe ateş ediyorum, ölmüyor; duvara sıkıyorum, headshot gidiyor. 1 saniye önce önümden geçen takım arkadaşım, sanki hâlâ önümdeymiş gibi kafasına yiyor kurşunu.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

CS:GO'da düzeltilen smoke bug'ı CS2'de tekrar çalışıyor. Majorde bile LAN ortamında mermi hataları, hitbox sorunları yaşandı. Yani sorun sadece bizde değil, profesyonel sahnede bile belirgin.

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor. 

Her neyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?

As a veteran, a public servant, and a Congressman who has long championed law, order, and responsible governance, I expect systems—whether in national security or online gaming—that are functional, accountable, and grounded in results. Counter-Strike 2, regrettably, is none of these. Valve’s rollout of this title mirrors the kind of bloated, unfocused legislation I regularly vote against: overpromised, underdelivered, and poorly implemented. The game lacks operational readiness—plagued by technical instability, inconsistent mechanics, and a serious deficit of quality control. If this were a federal program, it would be facing a bipartisan oversight hearing.

What’s more troubling is the erosion of community standards. I’ve supported efforts in Congress to reduce violence and promote personal responsibility, yet this game continues to allow toxic, even hostile, environments with little to no meaningful enforcement. We wouldn’t tolerate this kind of negligence in our schools or streets, and we shouldn’t tolerate it in our digital communities either. Just like I’ve pushed for common-sense reforms to improve public safety while preserving rights, I expect platforms like this to prioritize fairness, accountability, and player well-being—values that are clearly missing here.

In short, Counter-Strike 2 feels less like a strategic upgrade and more like a bureaucratic mess—flashy on paper, broken in practice. Gamers deserve better. Citizens deserve better. I cannot, in good conscience, recommend this title.

—Rep. Don Bacon (NE-02)
“Accountability matters—whether in Congress or competitive matchmaking.”

The game is problematic from top to bottom. AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no optimization. I shoot the enemy — they don’t die; I shoot a wall — it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

3–4 ziarenka ziela angielskiego

2 liście laurowe

5–6 ziaren pieprzu czarnego

Sól do smaku

(opcjonalnie) 1 goździk

Dodatki:
Natka pietruszki do podania

Makaron nitki

Mięso dokładnie opłucz, zalej zimną wodą (ok. 2–2,5 litra) w dużym garnku.

Zagotuj, zbierz szumowiny (szarą pianę z wierzchu), zmniejsz ogień do minimum – rosół powinien "mrugać", nie gotować się gwałtownie.

Dodaj przyprawy i gotuj na bardzo małym ogniu przez około 1,5 godziny.

W międzyczasie:

Obierz warzywa.

Cebulę przekrój na pół i przypal (np. na suchej patelni lub nad ogniem).

Dodaj warzywa i cebulę do rosołu, gotuj kolejne 45–60 minut.

Na koniec dopraw solą do smaku, ewentualnie pieprzem.

Przecedź rosół przez sitko, by był klarowny.

Podawaj z ugotowanym makaronem nitki i posiekaną natką pietruszki.

CS2 is a good game, but I think Valve needs to strengthen its anti-cheat system.

[h1]Counter Strike: A Problem-Filled Experience[/h1]

As much as I don't want to call it that, it's starting to get problematic for the lifecycle of our beloved game, and about damn time that we show our friends at Valve how much we care for [b]our favorite first person shooter[/b] in the state that it currently is. At this state, I won't be keeping my mouth shut, just like how Valve doesn't care for CS.

The game is problematic from top to bottom. Most of the time, AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no consistency whatsoever in gunplay. When you shoot the enemy — they usually won't register a hit but when you shoot a wall — somehow it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed by seconds ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head, instead of the enemy.

[b]Cheating or most importantly, the Anti Cheat that we were promised[/b] is yet another disaster. VACnet is nowhere near great and in most of the cases straight up insufficient even in cases when the enemy is rage-cheating. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards. People don't want to install various third-party services just to play one clean match.

The subtick system is beyond broken and in my honest opinion, should be scrapped entirely. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast players or objects start accelerating and even how peeking feels in-game. Sometimes, your peeks seem like you're sliding on butter and sometimes, on straight up sandpaper in terms of friction. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers pre-CS2 happen frequently on post-subtick-CS2 servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO somehow works again in CS2. Even at [b]Majors, the most prestigious & biggest tournaments of CS (where issues this severe shouldn't happen under ANY CIRCUMSTANCE),[/b] bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional, on-stage level. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed, not even starting on the fact of CS2-only glitches and bugs — in fact, these CS:GO bugs only seems to have worsened in CS2. And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. [b]So I want to conclude this by shooting a question to Valve:[/b]

[h3]When’s the new skin collection dropping then?[/h3]

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

在这个充斥着作弊者，装逼犯的垃圾游戏环境下，不顺心的 bad games 让你一度想着"再打这个游戏我他妈就是狗"。然而每当你忙完一天的工作，打开电脑，登陆 STEAM ，看着几位每天陪伴你的战友给你发来的 PM ，你便会又一次的热血沸腾起来！
你不得不承认，你爱这款游戏，他已经成为了你生活的一部盼。
Play one CS, play them all...

CS2 Seviyoruz Ama Bu Hâliyle Olmaz
Oyunu yıllardır oynayan biri olarak söylüyorum: Subtick sistemi kağıt üstünde güzel ama mermi kayıtları rezalet. Mermiler gitmiyor, hitler sayılmıyor.
Spray hissi yok, silahlar sanki rastgele ateş ediyor.
Karakter hareketleri tutarsız, yavaş, hitbox’lar bozuk gibi.
Bunny hop yapmak zor, hareket özgürlüğü kısıtlanmış.
FPS drop’ları, input lag, buglar hâlâ oyunda.

Bu bir nefret değil, uyarıdır.
Biz oyunun düzelmesini isteyen bir topluluğuz.
Valve’ın artık bu oyunu ciddiye alması gerekiyor.
Feedback veriyoruz ama karşılık yok. 
İllaki redit gibi platformlarda sorunları sizinle kanıt olarak paylaşmak zorundamıyız ??? 

CS2’yi seviyoruz. Ama bu hâliyle keyif almak çok zor.
Topluluk olarak buradayız. Lütfen sesimizi duyun.

[h1]Counter Strike: A Problem-Filled Experience[/h1]

As much as I don't want to call it that, it's starting to get problematic for the lifecycle of our beloved game, and about damn time that we show our friends at Valve how much we care for [b]our favorite first person shooter[/b] in the state that it currently is. At this state, I won't be keeping my mouth shut, just like how Valve doesn't care for CS.

The game is problematic from top to bottom. Most of the time, AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no consistency whatsoever in gunplay. When you shoot the enemy — they usually won't register a hit but when you shoot a wall — somehow it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed by seconds ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head, instead of the enemy.

[b]Cheating or most importantly, the Anti Cheat that we were promised[/b] is yet another disaster. VACnet is nowhere near great and in most of the cases straight up insufficient even in cases when the enemy is rage-cheating. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards. People don't want to install various third-party services just to play one clean match.

The subtick system is beyond broken and in my honest opinion, should be scrapped entirely. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast players or objects start accelerating and even how peeking feels in-game. Sometimes, your peeks seem like you're sliding on butter and sometimes, on straight up sandpaper in terms of friction. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers pre-CS2 happen frequently on post-subtick-CS2 servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO somehow works again in CS2. Even at [b]Majors, the most prestigious & biggest tournaments of CS (where issues this severe shouldn't happen under ANY CIRCUMSTANCE),[/b] bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional, on-stage level. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed, not even starting on the fact of CS2-only glitches and bugs — in fact, these CS:GO bugs only seems to have worsened in CS2. And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. [b]So I want to conclude this by shooting a question to Valve:[/b]

[h3]When’s the new skin collection dropping then?[/h3]

CS2: Sorunlarla Dolu Bir Deneyim

Oyun baştan sona problemli. AWP flick atışları nişan aldığınız yerin gerisine gidiyor. Optimizasyon yok. Rakibe ateş ediyorum, ölmüyor; duvara sıkıyorum, headshot gidiyor. 1 saniye önce önümden geçen takım arkadaşım, sanki hâlâ önümdeymiş gibi kafasına yiyor kurşunu.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

CS:GO'da düzeltilen smoke bug'ı CS2'de tekrar çalışıyor. Majorde bile LAN ortamında mermi hataları, hitbox sorunları yaşandı. Yani sorun sadece bizde değil, profesyonel sahnede bile belirgin.

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor. 

Her neyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?

Ich habe mir vor Kurzem Counter-Strike 2 gekauft und bin insgesamt sehr zufrieden. Das Spiel fühlt sich modern und flüssig an, die Grafik wurde deutlich verbessert, und auch das neue Soundsystem trägt positiv zur Atmosphäre bei. Besonders gut gefällt mir das überarbeitete Movement, das sich direkter und präziser anfühlt als beim Vorgänger.

Die klassischen CS-Elemente bleiben erhalten, was für langjährige Fans wie mich ein großer Pluspunkt ist. Die Matches machen richtig Spaß, und das kompetitive Gefühl ist stärker denn je.

Einziger negativer Punkt ist leider die hohe Anzahl an Cheatern. Man trifft in öffentlichen Spielen leider immer wieder auf unehrliche Spieler, was den Spielspaß manchmal trübt. Ich hoffe sehr, dass hier seitens der Entwickler noch nachgebessert wird.

Trotzdem ist Counter-Strike 2 ein sehr gelungenes Spiel und absolut empfehlenswert für alle Fans taktischer Shooter. Wer CS geliebt hat, wird auch mit CS2 viel Freude haben.

A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

C'est simple : tu tombes sur des russes , 75% de chances de tomber sur du wallhack degueulasse. Et je parle du mode premium ( donc la ranked. ) 

La difference entre les games est si flagrante. 

Une game tu tombe sur des mecs de ton niveaux  ( 5000 actuelle ) ca se passe , tu fais du 15 / 20 kill , une chance sur deux de win . 

Tu tombes sur des russes ? C'est du 13 - 0 , ca te tire dessus a l'autre bout de la map , te saute sur la tête bref du grand nimp.

Parlant matchmaking : Tu règles le ping dans les parametres pour pas dépasser les 50 / 60 . Tu tombes sur des mecs avec 150 ms , qui se tp , parfois même vas savoir t'es sur les serv USA.

Bref un jeu qui rapporte des millions et avec une communauté des plus cancer.

TR:

CS2: Sorunlarla Dolu Bir Deneyim

Oyun baştan sona problemli. AWP flick atışları nişan aldığınız yerin gerisine gidiyor. Optimizasyon yok. Rakibe ateş ediyorum, ölmüyor; duvara sıkıyorum, headshot gidiyor. 1 saniye önce önümden geçen takım arkadaşım, sanki hâlâ önümdeymiş gibi kafasına yiyor kurşunu.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

CS:GO'da düzeltilen smoke bug'ı CS2'de tekrar çalışıyor. Majorde bile LAN ortamında mermi hataları, hitbox sorunları yaşandı. Yani sorun sadece bizde değil, profesyonel sahnede bile belirgin.

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor. 

Her neyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?

CS2: Sorunlarla Dolu Bir Deneyim. Deneyim bile işkence.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde. Hile kullananlar ban yemiyor seçkin de top 10 oluyor hepsi.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

Oyun baştan sona problemli. AWP flick atışları nişan aldığınız yerin gerisine gidiyor. Optimizasyon yok. Rakibe ateş ediyorum, ölmüyor; duvara sıkıyorum, headshot gidiyor. 1 saniye önce önümden geçen takım arkadaşım, sanki hâlâ önümdeymiş gibi kafasına yiyor kurşunu.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

CS:GO'da düzeltilen smoke bug'ı CS2'de tekrar çalışıyor. Majorde bile LAN ortamında mermi hataları, hitbox sorunları yaşandı. Yani sorun sadece bizde değil, profesyonel sahnede bile belirgin.

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor. 

Her neyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?
До сегодняшнего дня было все отлично, но этот чертов лаг. Спасибо кс -1000 рейтинга и 30 минут бана. Игра просто вылетела и не запускалась,просто отлично

CS2: A Problem-Filled Experience

The game is problematic from top to bottom. AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no optimization. I shoot the enemy — they don’t die; I shoot a wall — it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor. 

Her neyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?

CS2: A Problem-Filled Experience

The game is problematic from top to bottom. AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no optimization. I shoot the enemy — they don’t die; I shoot a wall — it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

As a longtime fan of Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, I had high hopes for CS2. Unfortunately, the game feels more like a rushed downgrade than a worthy successor.

🎮 Gameplay:
Movement feels clunky and unnatural compared to CS:GO. Hit registration is inconsistent, and gunplay lacks the tight, responsive feel that defined the series. Peeking mechanics are broken, and taking gunfights often feels random rather than skill-based.

🛠️ Technical Issues:
Despite months since release, CS2 still suffers from major performance problems. FPS drops, stuttering, and server lag are far too common—even on decent hardware. For a competitive shooter, this is unacceptable.

💣 Lack of Content:
The map pool is limited, with fan favorites still missing. Community servers and custom game modes are a shadow of what they used to be in CS:GO. The game feels barebones, like an early beta pretending to be a full release.

🎨 Visuals and Sound:
Sure, it looks prettier with Source 2, but visuals don’t make up for everything else. The smoke physics are a neat trick, but the overall aesthetic feels cluttered. Sound design has taken a hit—footsteps and directional cues are harder to interpret than ever.

🧩 Overall:
CS2 is not the evolution fans were promised. It’s a buggy, stripped-down version of CS:GO with better graphics but worse gameplay. Valve seriously needs to listen to its community and fix this mess before the legacy of Counter-Strike is permanently damaged.

"Still the GOAT of Tactical Shooters"

CS2 brings a fresh coat of paint to the classic formula, and I’m loving it. The new engine makes everything feel smoother and more responsive, and the updated visuals are a big step up. Smokes are dynamic now, which adds a whole new layer of strategy.

Gunplay is still tight and satisfying, matchmaking feels more balanced, and it’s great to see Valve continuing to support one of the best competitive games out there.

If you loved CS:GO, this is the natural next step. And if you’re new? Welcome to your next obsession.

Highly recommend.

CS2: A Problem-Filled Experience

The game is problematic from top to bottom. AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no optimization. I shoot the enemy — they don’t die; I shoot a wall — it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only much worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?

CS2: Sorunlarla Dolu Bir Deneyim

Oyun baştan sona problemli. AWP flick atışları nişan aldığınız yerin gerisine gidiyor. Optimizasyon yok. Rakibe ateş ediyorum, ölmüyor; duvara sıkıyorum, headshot gidiyor. 1 saniye önce önümden geçen takım arkadaşım, sanki hâlâ önümdeymiş gibi kafasına yiyor kurşunu.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

CS:GO'da düzeltilen smoke bug'ı CS2'de tekrar çalışıyor. Majorde bile LAN ortamında mermi hataları, hitbox sorunları yaşandı. Yani sorun sadece bizde değil, profesyonel sahnede bile belirgin.

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor. 

Her neyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?

ENGLISH & TÜRKÇE
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
ENG:

CS2: A Problem-Filled Experience

The game is problematic from top to bottom. AWP flick shots land behind where you're aiming. There's no optimization. I shoot the enemy — they don’t die; I shoot a wall — it registers as a headshot. A teammate who passed in front of me a second ago somehow still seems to be in front of me and takes a bullet to the head.

Cheating is another disaster. VACnet is absolutely insufficient. Deathmatch and other modes are unplayable due to bot accounts farming weekly rewards.

The subtick system is broken. It doesn’t work as we were told — tick intervals still exist and even affect how fast we can peek in-game. Errors that never occurred on 64-tick servers happen frequently on subtick servers.

The smoke bug that was fixed in CS:GO works again in CS2. Even at the Major, bullet registration and hitbox issues occurred on LAN. So it’s not just us — the problems are clearly visible even at the professional level.

And while all this is happening, Valve releasing new skins honestly feels like mockery. None of the issues we complained about for years in CS:GO have been fixed — in fact, they’ve only ♥♥♥♥♥♥ worse in CS2.

Anyway, when’s the new skin collection dropping, Valve?
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TR:

CS2: Sorunlarla Dolu Bir Deneyim

Oyun baştan sona problemli. AWP flick atışları nişan aldığınız yerin gerisine gidiyor. Optimizasyon yok. Rakibe ateş ediyorum, ölmüyor; duvara sıkıyorum, headshot gidiyor. 1 saniye önce önümden geçen takım arkadaşım, sanki hâlâ önümdeymiş gibi kafasına yiyor kurşunu.

Hile konusu ayrı bir felaket. VACnet kesinlikle yetersiz. Deadmatch ve diğer modlar, haftalık ödül farmı yapan bot hesaplar yüzünden oynanamaz halde.

Subtick sistemi bozuk. Ayrıca bize anlatıldığı gibi çalışmıyor, tick aralıkları hala mevcut ve bu oyun içindeki peek hızımızı bile etkiler durumda. 64 tick sunucularda yaşanmayan hatalar subtick serverlarda fazlasıyla var.

CS:GO'da düzeltilen smoke bug'ı CS2'de tekrar çalışıyor. Majorde bile LAN ortamında mermi hataları, hitbox sorunları yaşandı. Yani sorun sadece bizde değil, profesyonel sahnede bile belirgin.

Bütün bunlar olurken Valve’in yeni skin getirmesi gerçekten oyuncuyla dalga geçmek gibi. CS:GO’da yıllarca şikâyet ettiğimiz şeyler düzeltilmemiş; aksine, CS2’de daha kötü hâlde karşımıza çıkıyor.

Herneyse, yeni skin koleksiyonu ne zaman çıkıyor valve?

КС с нами уже давно и все это время она остается видным представителем жанра и мощным конкурентом для множества шутеров. Удивительно, что такая, уже без сомнения великая, игра берет свое начало из всего лишь мода к Халф Лайф. И тут можно только поапладировать Гейбу и его команде за умение разглядеть бриллиант и отшлифовать его до уровня одной из самых популярных игр современности – ровно то же самое произошло и с Dota 2. 

Годы идут, какие-то игры хайпуют, какие-то скурвиваются под гнетом жадных топ-менеджментов (Call с его call-овыми скинами) или повестки (Rainbox Six с оперативниками в колясках), а некоторые и вовсе перестают существовать. А КС остается с нами – такая же консистентная, соревновательная, глубокая, скилло-зависимая и затягиваюшая. Она меняется, обновляется, экспериментирует. Иногда, конечно, допускает ошибки, но не ошибается только тот, кто ничего не делает. Слава Гейбу.

In Counter-Strike 2, many players have reported several performance and gameplay issues that significantly affect the experience. Here are some of the most common problems:

Subtick Inconsistencies:
CS2 uses a new subtick system, but many players feel that it doesn't work as intended. Actions such as shooting or moving sometimes feel delayed or inconsistent, making the game feel less responsive compared to CS:GO.

Bullet Registration Issues:
One of the most frustrating problems is poor bullet registration. Shots that appear to be on target often don’t hit, and there are frequent cases of bullets simply not registering, especially in high-pressure situations.

Low FPS and Performance Drops:
Despite having decent hardware, many users experience low FPS, stuttering, and random performance drops. This makes the game hard to play competitively and breaks immersion. Optimization issues seem to be affecting even high-end systems.

Input Lag and Delayed Peeks:
Due to subtick and performance problems, input lag is more noticeable, and peeking mechanics feel off. What you see on your screen doesn't always match what the server registers, leading to unfair deaths and confusion.

有人说这是当前最纯粹的FPS游戏，我想说不止如此，如果你认为它只是个纯粹的拼抢游戏那你大概率在入门之后的一段时间会经常坐牢。
我入门一年多，将近两千小时，越发认为队友的协同，地图的控制，信息的读取，道具的支持，战术的执行以及纪律性等才是在有了枪法啊基础之后更关键，更影响你游戏体验的因素。
所以我想说，不要把它紧紧当作是一款纯粹的射击游戏，它是一款非常考验五人配合的综合性游戏。有人会说我就是随便娱乐娱乐，下了班，放了学打打就为开心，更何况身边也没有一块玩的朋友，但是我想说一款游戏只有精益求精才会获得完美体验，否则见一个玩一个，到最后都是没有体会到这个游戏深层的魅力，久而久之也就会患上电子阳痿，至于朋友，大可以先玩再结识，里面多的是和你一样的人，我现在在CS也加了全球各地十几个好友，每天都是被人邀请上线的。
好的，最后祝各位有一个美好的游戏旅程。

Counter-Strike 2 é a evolução de um dos jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa mais icônicos da história dos videogames. Desenvolvido pela Valve, o jogo traz uma experiência intensa e altamente estratégica, que recompensa tanto a habilidade individual quanto o trabalho em equipe.

Com gráficos aprimorados graças à Source 2 Engine, CS2 oferece ambientes mais realistas, iluminação dinâmica e efeitos visuais que elevam a imersão sem perder a identidade clássica da franquia. A jogabilidade continua precisa e responsiva, com mecânicas refinadas que mantêm o ritmo rápido e competitivo das partidas.

O jogo também se destaca pelo seu forte apelo competitivo, com matchmaking balanceado e suporte completo a eSports. Além disso, Counter-Strike 2 mantém sua comunidade vibrante e engajada, com suporte a modos personalizados, skins e uma economia virtual ativa.

Seja para veteranos da série ou novos jogadores, CS2 oferece uma experiência viciante, tensa e recompensadora, consolidando-se como uma referência no gênero de FPS tático.

Joguei 9 horas seguidas e sinceramente acho que vai de gosto.
Sou da época do CS 1.0 láááá em 2003 a 2004 e o que posso dizer é que na época era maravilhoso porque não tinha nada melhor.

Hoje os FPS evoluíram drasticamente e tem muito mais coisas pra você desfrutar dentro do jogo do que CS.

A questão é que a mecânica é a mesma de antes e se você gosta de jogo simples onde você escolhe o que tem e sai atirando, tudo bem. É divertido. 

Basicamente CS é pra quem vai jogar meia hora e sair do computador porque ele não exige muito do seu tempo.

Se você quer um jogo com um monte de arma diferente e customizações absurdas, não é pra você. Como não é pra mim.

CSGO, a game that holds a special place in my heart. When I first encountered CSGO for the first time at a young age(im sad to say it was the roblox version) I instantly fell in love with it. I had played other shooters and this one was something different to me. It was fast paced, but balanced. It was not one of those games a brain dead person could excel at, it was perfection. I have played CSGO for 6 years now on different accounts and although it is always the same basic idea, every match I have played was different. CSGO is one of the few rare games I have played were I never get bored of it, I always find myself coming back to it. I have gone though weeks of terrible performance yet I still find pleasure in the game. CSGO is the game that never dies, because the community cannot let this game go. It is too perfect, the best FPS ever created. For those of you who are wondering wether to play this game or buying prime, you should do it. Even with cheaters, you will still come back to this game and to me, this game is priceless.

Honestly, CS2 is fucking trash. I can’t believe how badly they fucked this game up. It’s supposed to be an “upgrade” from CS:GO, but it feels like a shitty beta made by interns who’ve never touched a shooter in their life. Hackers everywhere. Every damn match there's some asshole walling, aimbotting, or doing some next-level bullshit and VAC just sits there doing absolutely nothing. “VAC Live” my ass.

And don’t even get me started on the hit reg. I shoot first, I die first. It’s like playing a lottery every round. Movement feels stiff as hell, the smokes are fancy but useless, and the whole thing just feels off. You can tell they rushed this shit just to slap Source 2 on it and pretend it’s the future of CS.

Meanwhile, matchmaking is a disaster. You either get paired with some god-tier smurfs or teammates with no hands. And when you finally get a decent match? Surprise—there’s a cheater ruining the whole thing anyway.

CS:GO had its flaws but at least it felt stable and playable. CS2 feels like someone took a working car, ripped out the engine, painted it pretty, and now expects you to drive it uphill with no wheels. It’s a fucking joke.

Valve clearly doesn’t give a shit anymore. As long as people keep buying $400 skins, they’re happy. Competitive integrity? Dead. The CS legacy? Burned to the ground.

I genuinely regret wasting time on this. Fuck CS2 :)

I'm not sure I would recommend this game.  The competitive and premier mode have ranking systems that encourage players to grind and depend on the RNG of the team you are placed on and the other team.  There is a way to commend players and get matched with them again, but in my opinion, what is missing is the opposite of commending, so you can not get matched with this player again as well as similar "play style" players again.  I think it could really help to help players have some sort of heuristic about the matches they have rather than valve's half baked ELO system that boils down to the seed of the RNG determining who goes where.  It's a team based game and the match making is blind to play styles-- It's a little too simple and creates a bunch of frustration and encourages people to grind playing with other players with random play styles and develop strange habits and like "localizes minima" meta based on the RNG ELO they get placed in.

Also I tried playing this game on mac (because it had an apple logo) shortly after release.  While it opened on a mac, the mouse wouldn't go into the window and it couldn't be made full screen.  I literally bought a windows to play this game and I couldn't be more disapionted with the repackaged CSGO matchmaking garbage. 

I cannot recommend playing matchmaking in this game-- it is a waste of your time and energy! Find something productive to do instead!

10/10

Counter-Strike 2 brings everything we love about the classic Counter-Strike series and takes it to the next level. The game, which became a cornerstone of esports, is back to elevate the tactical FPS experience while retaining the elemental simplicity that made the original so beloved.
The Classic Feel in a New Coat

CS2 doesn't try to radically change what's already working. The core gameplay – two teams, terrorists and counter-terrorists, with one side planting a bomb and the other trying to prevent it – is still the foundation. However, the new graphics engine brings a massive improvement, making the game visually stunning while keeping the fast-paced, high-skill gameplay that fans have always loved.
Tactical Depth and Precision Shooting

Counter-Strike has always been about teamwork and strategic thinking, and CS2 is no exception. Every decision you make—whether it’s how you spend your money, which weapons you choose, or how well you know the map—has a huge impact on the outcome. The precision shooting is sharper than ever, and the new weapons and tactical tools add even more depth to the gameplay.
The Art of Map Design

Maps have always been a key element in Counter-Strike, and CS2 is no different. Along with reworked classic maps (like Dust 2 and Inferno), there are new, innovative maps that offer fresh tactical opportunities. These redesigned maps give players more creative ways to play, while the realistic environments and decision-making opportunities take the experience to a whole new level.
Esports and the Community Experience

Counter-Strike 2 remains one of the leading games in esports, and there’s no better way to prove your skill than in competitive matches. The revamped matchmaking system and improved ranking system ensure you’re always playing against opponents of your skill level, while teamwork and strategic communication are pushed to new heights.
Community and Creative Opportunities

CS2 also thrives with community content. The game offers a more open platform for modders and custom map creators, allowing players to personalize their experience even further. Whether it’s new maps, weapons, or game modes, there are endless opportunities for the community to create and share.
Conclusion

Counter-Strike 2 strikes the perfect balance between the classic Counter-Strike feel and modern gameplay advancements. The updated graphics, deep tactical gameplay, and esports-focused experience ensure the game stays at the top. If you love fast, precise shooting, teamwork, and tight competition, then CS2 will definitely not disappoint!
